answers.answer: Hi,You need to consult your physician or a neurologist. Sounds in the ear may be because of removal of the block inside the canal. Eye problems and the noise in the ear might not be interrelated but you still need a thorough examination from your General physician.RegardsOHNS2010

question: This is really strange.  A few years ago I had a huge amount of scar tissue removed in a surgery on right ear.  My eardrum was healthy and I could hear until the healing process created more scar tissue.  A couple of months ago I had same doctor clean debris out of that ear, and I have been able to hear a bit better.  However, I get noises in my head coming mostly from the right side, it seems.  Kind of whooshing sounds, not ringing in the ear.  It is steady, goes down occasionally, but is always there.  I have also had cataract surgery on both eyes this past year.  I notice that when I lie down for a nap with eyes closed, I almost drift off and suddenly I am awakened by color best described as a sheet of color while my eyes are closed.  Sometimes it is all green, sometimes all red.  Between the ear and the colors, I am feeling like I might have a stroke.  I need to see my doc, but I can't since it is 200 miles away and I can't afford to travel at this time (I live on So. Oregon Coast).  This all worries me.  What kind of doc to see?  Primary care?  He will refer me to somewhere, what kind of specialist would I see?  I also started insulin for diabetes two months ago.
title: Hearing strange noises and seeing colors when eyes closed
